loc: p.1, Instructions ("All fields must be completed unless otherwise noted")

criteria.text: Standalone Energization Request form requires all fields completed and ERCOT approval prior to energization; incomplete submissions can delay the process.

review_notes: v0 seed rule: tighten required_fields and add additional intake docs as more clauses are encoded.

loc: p.8, Sec 6.0 "System Protection Requirements" (protection requirements depend on POD/location/line protection)

criteria.text: Oncor system protection requirements vary by POD and location; interconnections may require protection/relaying coordination and associated equipment.

review_notes: v0 seed rule: add specific protection/relay scheme triggers and any short-circuit/breaker duty clauses as separate rules.

loc: p.3, "How does ERCOT define a large load?"

criteria.text: A Large Load is one or more facilities at a single site with aggregate peak demand ≥ 75 MW behind common POI.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A).

loc: p.4, Section 9.2.1 Applicability

criteria.text: Planning Guide Section 9 applies to new Large Loads, load increases ≥75 MW, or POI relocation to a different bus/circuit.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.1, Overview ("peak demand of 75 MW or more at a single site")

criteria.text: Large Load Interconnection Process is framed around a single-site large load. If multiple POIs/sites are being considered, treat them as separate screening tracks and expect additional coordination/study overhead.

review_notes: v0: add an audit-friendly signal for multi-POI topology using Large Load Q&A single-site framing (does not replace ERCOT/TSP determinations).

loc: p.2, Overview ("applied to both stand-alone large load customers and those co-locating with existing or planned generation")

criteria.text: Large Load Interconnection Process explicitly includes large loads co-locating with existing or planned generation; such configurations can increase coordination and study dependency in screening.

review_notes: v0: add clause-anchored co-location applicability signal (Q&A overview) to close lever coverage for co-located configurations.

loc: pp.2–4, Overview (Texas SB6 Net Metering Review; "net metering arrangement"; "must also obtain approval" before load can be energized)

criteria.text: If an export/net-metering posture is contemplated (often implying co-located generation/storage), a Net Metering Review may apply; for certain arrangements involving existing stand-alone Generation/ESR, approval through the Net Metering Review is required before the load can be energized (bounded screening signal).

review_notes: v0: keep this evidence-backed but bounded. Request.export_capability is a posture signal; final Net Metering Review applicability depends on actual metering arrangements and resource status.

loc: p.6, "initiate the Large Load Interconnection Process?"

criteria.text: Large Load interconnection begins with submission to the responsible TSP including peak demand and requested energization date.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 required_fields/predicates.

loc: p.7, Planning Guide Section 9.2.2

criteria.text: Interconnecting Large Load must provide a preliminary Load Commissioning Plan specifying load increments and timeline to peak demand.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 intake fields.

loc: p.7, Planning Guide Section 9.2.2 fee requirement

criteria.text: Large Load must pay an ERCOT application fee in addition to TSP fees.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 intake field.

loc: p.7, Planning Guide Section 9.2.3

criteria.text: Material project changes (load type, timeline acceleration, POI change, control changes) may require full or partial re-study.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.8–9, "What types of reliability studies are required?"

criteria.text: Required studies include steady-state, dynamic/transient stability, and system protection (short-circuit) analysis.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.8, "Subsynchronous Oscillation study (SSO study)"

criteria.text: Subsynchronous Oscillation (SSO) study may be required and must be completed before energization.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A).

loc: p.10–11, Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.1

criteria.text: A load becomes must-study after completion of LLIS and execution of required agreements and financial security.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.10, "studies of other nearby large"

criteria.text: Re-studies may be required if another nearby load becomes a must-study load.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A).

loc: p.13, Planning Guide Sections 9.5–9.6

criteria.text: Before energization, all LLIS studies must be completed, agreements executed, financial security provided, and commissioning plan submitted.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 gate predicates.

loc: p.12–13, "Network Operations Model"

criteria.text: Load must be included in ERCOT Network Operations Model before energization.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.14–15, "voltage and frequency ride-through risks"

criteria.text: Large Electronic Loads must meet voltage and frequency ride-through standards or may be subject to curtailment.

review_notes: v0: mark as conditional gate (applies only if is_large_electronic_load=true).

loc: p.15, Planning Guide Section 9.4(10)

criteria.text: If energization requirements are not met within 365 days of requested energization date used for LLIS, TSP must determine whether re-studies are required.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 required field.

loc: p.16, Planning Guide Sections 9.2.2 & 9.6

criteria.text: Large load must maintain consumption within Load Commissioning Plan limits; exceeding requires notification and approval.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Large Load Q&A). Added v0 predicates.

loc: Section 1.1, p.1

criteria.text: Applies to interconnections at transmission voltages (69 kV and higher).

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Scoped to transmission-voltage POIs.

loc: Section 3.4.1, p.3

criteria.text: Transmission voltages are 69 kV, 138 kV, and 345 kV. Not all voltages may be available at a given location.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Added v0 predicates. Scoped to transmission-voltage POIs.

loc: Section 3.4.1, p.3 ("The actual voltage for a Point of Delivery will be determined through analyses"; "Not all voltages may be available")

criteria.text: If both 138 kV and 345 kV are being considered as options, the actual POD voltage must be determined through Company analyses and availability may constrain choices.

review_notes: Evidence-backed lever rule: multiple voltage options imply additional analysis/coordination; used to make voltage-choice options comparable in v0 scoring.

loc: Section 3.4.1, p.3 ("The actual voltage for a Point of Delivery will be determined through analyses"; "Not all voltages may be available")

criteria.text: If both 69 kV and 138 kV are being considered as options, the actual POD voltage must be determined through Company analyses and availability may constrain choices.

review_notes: Evidence-backed lever rule: multiple voltage options imply additional analysis/coordination; used to make voltage-choice options comparable in v0 scoring.

loc: Section 3.4.1, p.3 ("The actual voltage for a Point of Delivery will be determined through analyses"; "Not all voltages may be available")

criteria.text: If both 69 kV and 345 kV are being considered as options, the actual POD voltage must be determined through Company analyses and availability may constrain choices.

review_notes: Evidence-backed lever rule: multiple voltage options imply additional analysis/coordination; used to make voltage-choice options comparable in v0 scoring.

loc: Section 4.1.8, p.6

criteria.text: Customer must provide initial and five-year load projections including peak load power factor.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Scoped to transmission-voltage POIs.

loc: Section 4.1.6, p.6

criteria.text: Customer must submit a one-line electrical diagram of proposed facilities (initial and ultimate).

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Scoped to transmission-voltage POIs.

loc: Section 5.2.1, p.7

criteria.text: Customer protective equipment must be fully rated to interrupt available fault current.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Added v0 predicate. Scoped to transmission-voltage POIs.

loc: Section 6.1.1, p.8

criteria.text: If substation is <1000 ft from transmission line, customer must install two independent fault sensing systems.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106).

loc: Section 6.1.1, p.8

criteria.text: Primary clearing device must complete disconnection within 6 cycles.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106).

loc: Section 6.1.2, p.11

criteria.text: If substation >1000 ft, breaker must have max clearing time of 3 cycles.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106).

loc: Section 3.6.1, p.3–4

criteria.text: Metering of service at each Point of Delivery is required.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Added v0 predicate. Scoped to transmission-voltage POIs.

loc: Section 3.3.2, p.3

criteria.text: ERCOT approval via NOMCR process is required before connecting new or modified transmission facilities.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106). Added v0 predicates.

loc: Section 7.1.3, p.22

criteria.text: Company may demand Customer remove part or all load if conditions endanger persons or property.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Oncor 520-106).

loc: p.3, "may not proceed until written approval"

criteria.text: Initial energization may not proceed until written approval of the form is given by ERCOT.

sources.loc: PDF p.3 (written approval required before energization)

evidence: ERCOT written approval of the Energization Request form prior to energization (form p.3)
Signed/attested Energization Request form submitted to ERCOT (form p.3)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Submit the Energization Request form and obtain ERCOT written approval before proceeding to initial energization.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.1, "already energized are covered by a different form"

criteria.text: Form applies to new energizations only; peak demand increases require a different form.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.2, "All studies required per the Large Load Interconnection Study process have been completed and approved"

criteria.text: All studies required per the LLIS process must be completed and approved per Planning Guide Section 9.4.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (TSP confirms LLIS studies completed and approved by ERCOT)

evidence: Energization Request form attestation that all required LLIS studies have been completed and approved by ERCOT (form p.2)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Confirm all LLIS studies are completed and approved by ERCOT before requesting energization approval.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.2, "Is a SSO study required for this Large Load interconnection?"

criteria.text: Confirm whether an SSO study is required for this project (v0 input). If required, the SSO completion gate applies.

review_notes: v0: add explicit applicability input for conditional gate.

loc: p.2, "The SSO study is complete and all required mitigation is in place"

criteria.text: If an SSO study is required, it must be complete and mitigation must be in place before energization.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (SSO required? If yes, SSO study complete and mitigation operational)

evidence: Energization Request form: SSO required? and (if yes) confirmation that the SSO study is complete and required mitigation is in place/operational (form p.2)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: If an SSO study is required, complete the SSO study and ensure required mitigation is in place and operational before energization.

review_notes: v0: make conditional gate explicit via sso_required input.

loc: p.2, "Large Electronic Load (LEL)"

criteria.text: If facility is a Large Electronic Load (LEL), it must be included in ERCOT interim ride-through assessment.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (LEL: included in ERCOT interim ride-through assessment)

evidence: Energization Request form: if facility is a Large Electronic Load (LEL), confirmation that it has been included in an ERCOT interim ride-through assessment (form p.2)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: If the facility is a Large Electronic Load (LEL), ensure it is included in the required ERCOT interim ride-through assessment before energization.

review_notes: v0: mark as conditional gate (applies only if is_large_electronic_load=true).

loc: p.2, "All required interconnection agreements"

criteria.text: All interconnection agreements must be executed and financial security posted per Planning Guide Section 9.5.1.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (agreements executed and financial security posted)
PDF p.2 (form states agreements/security per Planning Guide Section 9.5.1)

evidence: Energization Request form: confirmation that required interconnection/service agreements are executed and required financial security has been posted (form p.2)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Ensure required interconnection/service agreements are executed and required financial security is posted before requesting energization approval.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.2, "no changes have been made to the load composition"

criteria.text: ILLE must confirm no substantial changes in load composition or parameters from dynamic model used in LLIS Stability Study.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (written acknowledgement from ILLE: no substantial changes vs dynamic model)

evidence: Written acknowledgement from the ILLE that no substantial changes have been made vs the dynamic model used in the LLIS Stability Study (form p.2)
Energization Request form attestation that the interconnecting TSP has received this acknowledgement (form p.2)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Obtain the ILLE's written acknowledgement that no substantial changes have been made vs the dynamic model assumptions used in the LLIS stability study.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicate.

loc: p.2, "obligation to notify the interconnecting TSP of changes"

criteria.text: ILLE must notify TSP of future changes to project information per Planning Guide Section 9.2.3.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request).

loc: p.2, "Maintain Load consumption at or below"

criteria.text: Load consumption must remain at or below peak demand indicated in the Load Commissioning Plan.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request).

loc: p.3, "any request to increase the amount of peak Demand"

criteria.text: Any request to increase peak Demand beyond approved amount requires a separate Large Load increase form and ERCOT approval.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request).

loc: p.2, "included in the Network Operations Model"

criteria.text: Large Load must be included in the ERCOT Network Operations Model before energization.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (NOM included; provide NOMCR # / Production Load Date / Maximum MW Modeled)
PDF p.3 (written approval required before energization)

evidence: Completed Energization Request form NOM section (NOMCR #, Production Load Date, Maximum MW Modeled) (form p.2)
ERCOT written approval of the Energization Request form (form p.3)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Confirm the Large Load is included in the Network Operations Model (NOM) and provide the NOMCR details as part of the Energization Request prior to energization.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicates.

loc: p.2, "Disturbance Monitoring Equipment (DME) is required"

criteria.text: Confirm whether ERCOT requires Disturbance Monitoring Equipment (DME) for this project (v0 input). If required, the DME installation gate applies.

review_notes: v0: add explicit applicability input for conditional gate.

loc: p.2, "Is the DME installed and configured?"

criteria.text: If ERCOT requires Disturbance Monitoring Equipment (DME), it must be installed and operational.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (DME required? If yes, installed/configured and provide operational date)

evidence: Energization Request form: ERCOT notification whether DME is required; if required, confirmation DME installed/configured and projected operational date (form p.2)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: If ERCOT requires DME for the facility, install/configure the DME and document the operational date as part of the Energization Request.

review_notes: v0: make conditional gate explicit via dme_required input.

loc: p.2, "All required telemetry required by the ERCOT Protocols"

criteria.text: All required telemetry per ERCOT Protocols must be operational and accurate before energization.

sources.loc: PDF p.2 (telemetry operational/accurate as-of date)
PDF p.1 (telemetry contact fields)

evidence: Energization Request form: telemetry operational/accurate as-of date (form p.2)
Telemetry contact fields on the Energization Request form (form p.1)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Confirm all required telemetry is operational and accurate and record the as-of date on the Energization Request.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (Standalone Energization Request). Added v0 predicate.

loc: Section 3.1.2, pp.7–8

criteria.text: All inverter-based resources (IBRs), wind generation resources (WGRs), and inverter-based transmission elements (IBTEs) installed on or after January 2015 must submit PSCAD dynamic models to ERCOT.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (DWG Procedure Manual). Likely v1 for load-only product.

loc: Section 3.1.5, p.9

criteria.text: Dynamic planning and operations models must be accompanied by Model Quality Test (MQT) results including simulation files and plots.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (DWG Procedure Manual).

criteria.text: IBRs and inverter-based transmission elements must be tested under short circuit ratios of 5, 3, 1.5, and 1.2; models must provide acceptable responses for SCR of 3 and higher.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (DWG Procedure Manual). High value if modeling/stability is in scope.

loc: Section 4.1.4, pp.41–42

criteria.text: DWG flat start cases must initialize with no errors and demonstrate stable 20-second no-disturbance simulation.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (DWG Procedure Manual).

loc: Section 3.2.2, p.34

criteria.text: Resource Entities must submit dynamic model updates within 30 days of any facility change or test result requiring update.

review_notes: Imported seed rule (DWG Procedure Manual).

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.1 ("following criteria shall be subject to the Large Load Interconnection Study (LLIS)")

criteria.text: Projects meeting Planning Guide Section 9.2.1 criteria are subject to the Large Load Interconnection Study (LLIS) process.

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 (Large Load) seed rule for stronger clause-level provenance.

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.1(a) ("A new Large Load;")

criteria.text: A new Large Load is subject to the LLIS process per Planning Guide Section 9.2.1(a).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 (Large Load) seed rule for clause-level citation.

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.1(b) ("increases the aggregate peak")

criteria.text: A modification of an existing Load Facility that increases the aggregate peak demand is subject to the LLIS process per Planning Guide Section 9.2.1(b).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 (Large Load) seed rule for clause-level citation.

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.1(c) ("changes or adds a Point of")

criteria.text: A modification of an existing Large Load that changes or adds a Point of Interconnection / Service Delivery Point (per Planning Guide Section 9.2.1(c)) is subject to LLIS.

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 (Large Load) seed rule for clause-level citation.

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.2(1)(b) ("Submission of a preliminary Load Commissioning Plan (LCP)")

criteria.text: Prior to initiation of LLIS, the ILLE must submit a preliminary Load Commissioning Plan (LCP) that fully reflects the project schedule (Planning Guide Section 9.2.2(1)(b)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 intake prerequisite (mirrors Q&A but anchors to Planning Guide).

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.2(1)(c) ("Written acknowledgement from the Interconnecting Large Load Entity (ILLE)")

criteria.text: Prior to initiation of LLIS, written acknowledgement from the ILLE of obligations (including notification of project changes per Section 9.2.3) is required (Planning Guide Section 9.2.2(1)(c)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 initiation prerequisite; v0 input field represents acknowledgement captured/confirmed.

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.2(1)(d) ("A formal request to initiate the LLIS process")

criteria.text: Prior to initiation of LLIS, a formal request to initiate the LLIS process is required (Planning Guide Section 9.2.2(1)(d)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 initiation prerequisite; v0 input field represents request submitted/confirmed.

loc: p.130, Section 9.2.2(1)(e) ("Payment of the LLIS Application Fee")

criteria.text: Prior to commencement of LLIS, the ILLE shall pay the LLIS Application Fee to ERCOT (Planning Guide Section 9.2.2(1)(e)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9 fee prerequisite (mirrors Q&A but anchors to Planning Guide).

loc: p.132, Section 9.3.1(1) ("An LLIS consists of the set of steady-state, stability, short-circuit")

criteria.text: An LLIS consists of steady-state, stability, short-circuit, and other relevant study elements (Planning Guide Section 9.3.1(1)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.3.1 anchors required study elements to clause text.

loc: p.132, Section 9.3.1(4) ("interconnecting at distribution voltage"; "LLIS shall evaluate only ... transmission-level impacts"; "DSP shall provide ... information")

criteria.text: For a Large Load interconnecting at distribution voltage, the LLIS evaluates only transmission-level impacts (if any) and requires coordination/input from the affected DSP to complete required studies.

review_notes: Lever coverage: makes poi_voltage_class=distribution affect study dependency/timeline pressure with Planning Guide clause support.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.5(1) ("interconnected at transmission voltage"; "must have ... breakers capable of interrupting fault current"; "remote control" by TO)

criteria.text: Each Service Delivery Point for a Large Load (not co-located) interconnected at transmission voltage must have a permanent configuration with breakers capable of interrupting fault current to isolate the Large Load without interrupting flow on associated transmission lines, under remote control of the applicable Transmission Operator.

review_notes: Clause-backed equipment/operations requirement for transmission-voltage large loads; modeled as protection/upgrade exposure + timeline pressure in v0.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.5(2) ("co-located"; "breakers ... isolate the Large Load ... without isolating any of the co-located generators"; "direction of the QSE")

criteria.text: Each Large Load co-located with a Generation Resource/ESR/SOG and interconnected at transmission voltage must have a permanent breaker configuration capable of isolating the Large Load without isolating co-located generators; breakers must be remotely controllable at the direction of the applicable QSE.

review_notes: Clause-backed co-location variant of breaker/controls requirement; adds operations exposure signal in v0 due to QSE-directed controls and operational coordination.

loc: p.132, Section 9.3.1(4) ("distribution voltage"; "DSP shall provide ... information")

criteria.text: For distribution-voltage Large Load interconnections, the affected DSP must provide the lead TSP with facility information needed to complete required studies (Planning Guide Section 9.3.1(4)).

review_notes: Bucket/missing_inputs lever: makes distribution-voltage path depend on DSP information availability, with clause-level provenance.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.5(1)-(2) ("interconnected at transmission voltage"; breaker configuration; remote control by TO / direction of QSE)

criteria.text: For transmission-voltage Large Load interconnections, confirm the required permanent breaker configuration is in place/confirmed (Planning Guide Section 9.2.5).

sources.loc: PDF p.131, Section 9.2.5(1)-(2) (Required interconnection equipment; breaker configuration; remote control)

evidence: One-line / switching diagram showing the permanent breaker configuration at the Service Delivery Point(s) (PG Section 9.2.5)
Confirmation that breakers are capable of interrupting fault current and are remotely controllable as required (PG Section 9.2.5)
memo_guidance.what_to_do: Confirm and document the required transmission-voltage breaker configuration (fault interruption + remote control) per Planning Guide Section 9.2.5.

review_notes: Checklist gate upgrade: turns Section 9.2.5 breaker requirement into an auditable readiness gate when poi_voltage_class is confirmed as transmission. Uses derived applicability field to avoid false failures when distribution/unknown.

loc: p.137, Section 9.4(6) ("The LLIS is deemed complete when the final report")

criteria.text: The LLIS is deemed complete when the final report has been provided for all LLIS study elements (Planning Guide Section 9.4(6)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.4 anchors the definition of LLIS completion for audit trail.

loc: p.130, Section 9.2.3 ("within ten Business Days")

criteria.text: After notification of a material change, the lead TSP updates submitted project information within ten Business Days (Planning Guide Section 9.2.3).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.3 anchors the material-change update timing to clause text.

loc: p.130, Section 9.2.3 ("dynamic model information used in the LLIS stability study")

criteria.text: A material change to information used in the LLIS stability study dynamic model can impact study assumptions and trigger re-evaluation (Planning Guide Section 9.2.3).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.3 anchors dynamic-model change sensitivity to clause text.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.4 ("9.2.4 Load Commissioning Plan")

criteria.text: The Load Commissioning Plan (LCP) is governed by Planning Guide Section 9.2.4 and must be maintained/updated as the project proceeds.

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.4 anchor rule to strengthen provenance for LCP-related requirements.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.4(2) ("Upon the completion of the LLIS")

criteria.text: Upon completion of the LLIS, the LCP is updated to reflect LLIS results (Planning Guide Section 9.2.4(2)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.4(2) anchored as an LCP maintenance requirement; v0 models it as LCP provided/current.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.4(3) ("Upon the execution of any required agreements")

criteria.text: Upon execution of required agreements (Section 9.5), the LCP must be updated (Planning Guide Section 9.2.4(3)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.4(3) anchored as an LCP maintenance requirement (kept out of energization checklist to avoid bloat).

loc: p.135, Section 9.3.4.1 ("9.3.4.1 Steady-State Analysis")

criteria.text: The LLIS includes a Steady-State Analysis element (Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.1).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.1 clause-level anchor for steady-state study element.

loc: p.136, Section 9.3.4.2 ("System Protection (Short-Circuit) Analysis")

criteria.text: The LLIS includes a System Protection (Short-Circuit) Analysis element (Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.2).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.2 clause-level anchor for short-circuit/protection study element.

loc: p.136, Section 9.3.4.3 ("Dynamic and Transient Stability Analysis")

criteria.text: The LLIS includes a Dynamic and Transient Stability Analysis element (Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.3).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.3.4.3 clause-level anchor for dynamic/transient stability study element.

loc: p.141, Section 9.6(a) ("Inclusion of the Load in the Network Operations Model")

criteria.text: Initial Energization prerequisites include inclusion of the Load in the Network Operations Model (Planning Guide Section 9.6(a)).

memo_guidance.what_to_do: Confirm required telemetry is operational and accurate (document the as-of date on the Energization Request) and obtain ERCOT written approval prior to energization.

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.6(b) anchored energization prerequisite for telemetry operational/accurate.

loc: p.141, Section 9.6(d) ("Subsynchronous Oscillation (SSO)")

criteria.text: Initial Energization prerequisites include completion and approval of any required Subsynchronous Oscillation (SSO) studies (Planning Guide Section 9.6(d)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.6(d) anchored as conditional energization gate via sso_required input.

loc: p.141, Section 9.6(e) ("Submission of a current Load Commissioning Plan (LCP)")

criteria.text: Initial Energization prerequisites include submission of a current Load Commissioning Plan (LCP) meeting Section 9.2.4 requirements (Planning Guide Section 9.6(e)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.6(e) anchored energization prerequisite for current LCP.

loc: p.100, ("ERCOT has communicated the completion of the LLIS")

criteria.text: Energization gating condition references ERCOT communication of LLIS completion (Planning Guide: "ERCOT has communicated the completion of the LLIS...").

review_notes: Planning Guide clause-level gate to replace form/Q&A citation for LLIS completion in checklist.

loc: pp.139-140, Section 9.5 ("have received the financial security required")

criteria.text: Execution of required interconnection agreements and provision of required financial security are gating conditions tied to Planning Guide Section 9.5 responsibilities.

review_notes: Planning Guide clause-level gate to replace form/Q&A citation for agreements+financial security in checklist.

loc: p.129, Section 9.2.2(1)(a) ("Submission of all information, including but not limited to, data required by the lead Transmission Service Provider (TSP) to perform steady state, short circuit, motor start, stability analyses")

criteria.text: Prior to initiation of the LLIS process, submission of the study data package required by the lead TSP (steady state, short-circuit, motor start, stability inputs and other necessary data) is required (Planning Guide Section 9.2.2(1)(a)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.2(1)(a) fills the v0 gap for the LLIS study data package prerequisite.

loc: p.130, Section 9.2.3(2) ("The ILLE shall notify the lead TSP if a change to the load composition, technology, or parameters occurs")

criteria.text: If a material change to load composition/technology/parameters occurs after initial dynamic load model submission, the ILLE shall notify the lead TSP (Planning Guide Section 9.2.3(2)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.3(2) strengthens the change-control/notification obligation with clause-level citation.

loc: p.130, Section 9.2.3(2) ("the lead TSP shall determine whether a new stability study is required and provide a written explanation")

criteria.text: If post-initiation changes differ substantially from the dynamic model information used in the LLIS stability study, the lead TSP shall determine whether a new stability study is required and provide a written explanation to ERCOT (Planning Guide Section 9.2.3(2)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.3(2) clause-level anchor for stability-study restudy determination after substantial change.

loc: p.131, Section 9.2.4(1) ("The LCP must specify the load increments and timeline by which the ILLE intends to increase peak Demand")

criteria.text: When a phased energization plan is used in screening, the LCP must specify load increments and timeline; v0 models this as providing a phased schedule (phases) consistent with the LCP (Planning Guide Section 9.2.4(1)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.2.4(1) leveraged to make phased-plan lever actionable via phases[] completeness.

loc: p.138, Section 9.4(9) ("If the requirements of Section 9.5, have not been satisfied within 180 days after the communication of the completion of the LLIS")

criteria.text: If Section 9.5 requirements are not satisfied within 180 days after ERCOT communication of LLIS completion, the project may be subject to cancellation; in v0 this is flagged when agreements are known to be not executed post-LLIS (Planning Guide Section 9.4(9)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.4(9) cancellation risk surfaced as a deterministic flag when agreements are explicitly not executed.

loc: p.138, Section 9.4(9) ("If the requirements of Section 9.5, have not been satisfied within 180 days after the communication of the completion of the LLIS")

criteria.text: If Section 9.5 requirements are not satisfied within 180 days after ERCOT communication of LLIS completion, the project may be subject to cancellation; in v0 this is flagged when financial security is known to be not posted post-LLIS (Planning Guide Section 9.4(9)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.4(9) cancellation risk surfaced as a deterministic flag when financial security is explicitly not posted.

loc: p.138, Section 9.4(10) ("within 365 days after the Initial Energization date identified in the LLIS study report, the lead TSP shall provide an opinion to ERCOT on whether any of the completed LLIS elements require restudy")

criteria.text: If Initial Energization requirements are not met within 365 days after the Initial Energization date identified in the LLIS study report, the lead TSP provides an opinion on whether completed LLIS elements require restudy; ERCOT may require updates prior to approval (Planning Guide Section 9.4(10)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.4(10) adds clause-level authority for the 365-day restudy signal (preferred over Q&A when available).

loc: p.141, Section 9.6(1)(c) ("Completion of the requirements of Section 5.3.5, ERCOT Quarterly Stability Assessment")

criteria.text: Initial Energization prerequisites may include completion of ERCOT Quarterly Stability Assessment (QSA) requirements when applicable (Planning Guide Section 9.6(1)(c)).

sources.loc: PDF p.141, Section 9.6(1)(c) (Completion of the requirements of Section 5.3.5, ERCOT Quarterly Stability Assessment)
PDF pp.77-79, Section 5.3.5 (Quarterly Stability Assessment: eligibility, prerequisites, deadlines)
PDF p.79, Section 5.3.5(7) (ERCOT posts QSA results report to MIS Secure Area within 10 Business Days)

evidence: ERCOT quarterly stability assessment completed for the relevant period (Planning Guide Section 5.3.5) and results report posted to the MIS Secure Area (PG 5.3.5(7))
Prerequisites for Large Load inclusion in the quarterly stability assessment satisfied by the applicable deadlines (PG 5.3.5(2)/(5))
memo_guidance.what_to_do: If applicable for the target energization period, ensure the project meets the prerequisites for inclusion in ERCOT's Quarterly Stability Assessment (Section 5.3.5) and track completion of the assessment/results report before energization.

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.6(1)(c) modeled as a conditional energization gate via ercot_quarterly_stability_assessment_required; unknown applicability should not block readiness in v0.

loc: p.139, Section 9.5.1(iii) ("The interconnecting TSP has received notice to proceed with the construction of all required interconnection Facilities")

criteria.text: As part of Section 9.5.1 prerequisites, the interconnecting TSP has received notice to proceed with construction of all required interconnection facilities (Planning Guide Section 9.5.1(iii)).

review_notes: Planning Guide Section 9.5.1(iii) added as a memo-grade energization readiness gate (notice to proceed).

loc: M-A122325-01, LONG DESCRIPTION: "PGRR115, implemented on December 15, 2025, is an improvement ... but these new regulatory changes are already insufficient to manage the increase in the volume of Large Loads that ERCOT is seeing. Development of a new interconnection process called the 'Batch Study process' is ERCOT's focus over the next several weeks."

criteria.text: ERCOT has announced its intent to implement a Batch Study Process for Large Load Interconnection Studies (LLIS), replacing the current individualized study model. Projects submitted or pending study approval after the effective date of the batch process are expected to enter the queue as cohorts rather than individually; timing and process details are subject to final ERCOT/PUCT approval.

review_notes: Sourced from ERCOT market notice series M-A122325. Describes macro policy shift to batch studies. Treat as governance dependency: project timing may shift to next batch window. Do not confuse with any specific study result. Promote to reviewed after confirming current notice status from ercot.com.

loc: ERCOT-Large-Load-Batch-Studies-LLWG_01222026.pptx, slide deck (batch cycle windows; submission deadlines)

criteria.text: Under the proposed ERCOT Batch Study Process, Large Load projects will be studied in periodic cohort windows. Missing a batch cycle submission deadline delays the project to the next available batch window, potentially adding 6–12+ months to timeline.

review_notes: Sourced from LLWG batch study PPT (Jan 2026). Batch window details are subject to revision before final implementation. Confidence 0.75 pending final ERCOT/PUCT rule finalization. Promote to reviewed once batch cycle windows are confirmed in published guidance.

loc: ERCOT-Large-Load-Batch-Studies-LLWG_01222026.pptx, fast-track/priority path section

criteria.text: The proposed ERCOT batch study framework includes discussion of a fast-track or priority path for projects meeting specific eligibility criteria (e.g., smaller load, simpler configurations, or transmission-ready POIs). If eligible, a project may avoid a full batch cycle and achieve faster LLIS completion.

review_notes: Fast-track eligibility criteria were under discussion as of Jan 2026 LLWG. Promote only after ERCOT confirms eligibility criteria. Until then keep as draft/flag-only signal to highlight optionality.

loc: ERCOT Calendar – 02/26/2026 Batch Study Process Workshop #3

criteria.text: ERCOT is actively conducting Batch Study Process Workshops (Workshop #3 scheduled 2026-02-26). The batch study process rules are not yet finalized; projects should monitor ERCOT workshop outcomes and notice updates before finalizing scheduling assumptions.

review_notes: Informational marker for memo: the governance process is live as of today (2026-02-26). Update this rule's effective_date and confidence once batch process rules are finalized.

loc: M-A122325-01, LONG DESCRIPTION: "The rapid increase in Large Load interconnection requests has created structural challenges, including coordination across TSPs, repeated restudies, and a growing backlog of requests."

criteria.text: Under the transition from individualized to batch LLIS, queue position priority and study sequence will be governed by the new batch process rules rather than first-come-first-served individual study scheduling. Projects should not rely on informal queue position estimates from non-authoritative sources until ERCOT publishes final batch study mechanics.

review_notes: Key memo message: queue position from third-party sources (news, commercial sites) is unreliable under current governance transition. This rule supports memo's 'queue evidence layer' narrative.

loc: M-A022326-01, full notice – LONG DESCRIPTION: "Effective immediately, ERCOT requires TSPs to include a no-solar scenario as part of LLIS for Large Loads proposing to interconnect within the list of counties identified in this Market Notice."

criteria.text: ERCOT market notice M-A022326-01 describes additional reliability constraints for Large Load Interconnection Studies in the Far West Texas area, specifically a 'no-solar scenario' assumption that can result in more conservative (and potentially more costly or delay-inducing) study outcomes for projects in that region.

review_notes: Sourced from M-A022326-01. In v0 this fires as a flag/risk signal for any project. In a future version, add a geo/region field to the request schema and scope this rule to Far West Texas projects only.

loc: M-A022326-01, LONG DESCRIPTION: "ERCOT considers the identification of this risk to be a material change that impacts one or more LLIS study assumptions for interconnection requests in the identified counties." Per PG §9.4(8).

criteria.text: ERCOT study assumptions for Far West Texas LLIS include assumptions about the regional generation mix (e.g., solar availability). If the assumed generation fleet changes materially during or after the study period, study results may need to be revisited under updated assumptions.

review_notes: Companion rule to FAR_WEST_001. Captures the 'study assumptions may evolve' dimension for the Far West scenario. Both rules should be promoted together.

loc: PUCT Project No. 58481, docket filing (Sierra Club comments on 2nd Discussion Draft, 16 TAC §25.194, Jan 9 2026 workshop); rulemaking ongoing

criteria.text: PUCT Project No. 58481 is an active rulemaking proceeding that may result in changes to the regulatory framework governing Large Load Interconnection in Texas. Projects with long timelines should monitor this proceeding; final rules may modify planning obligations, fees, or process steps not yet reflected in the current Planning Guide.

review_notes: v0: informational governance-dependency signal. Keep confidence ≤0.8 until proceeding concludes and rule text is final. When final, update doc_id to the adopted rule, add specific section citations, and re-promote.

loc: PUCT Project No. 58481, docket (16 TAC §25.194); also corroborated by ERCOT_LARGE_LOAD_QA_REV20251215 p.14 ("PUC is in the process of establishing new interconnection standards for large loads in Project No. 58481")

criteria.text: Pending PUCT regulatory changes may alter Large Load interconnection obligations including but not limited to: study timelines, fee structures, agreement terms, and TSP responsibilities. Projects in early-stage planning should explicitly track PUCT Project 58481 for potential impacts to their interconnection schedule.

review_notes: v0: broad regulatory dependency marker. Lower confidence (0.7) as impact scope is speculative. Pair with PUCT_001 for memo context.

loc: Rev.12.15.25, p.14 ("PUC is in the process of establishing new interconnection standards for large loads in Project No. 58481. That rulemaking could require changes to ERCOT's large load interconnection process and delay projects that must meet new requirements.")

criteria.text: Under Texas SB6 and the revised Large Load Q&A (Rev. 12.15.25): if an export/net-metering arrangement is contemplated, approval through the Net Metering Review is required before the load can be energized. This requirement applies to certain co-located arrangements with existing or planned generation/ESR (bounded screening signal; final applicability depends on metering arrangements).

review_notes: Updated citation from 2025-06-01 Q&A to Rev.12.15.25. Content is substantially similar to LL_QA_018 but anchors to the latest version. Once Rev.12.15.25 PDF is in docs/snapshots and sha256 is filled, promote to reviewed.

loc: M-A122325-01, full notice (batch study process announcement, Dec 23 2025; PGRR115 already insufficient; batch study as successor framework)

criteria.text: ERCOT announced on Dec 23, 2025 (M-A122325-01) that PGRR115, implemented Dec 15, 2025, is already insufficient to manage the volume of large load requests. ERCOT is developing a new "Batch Study process" as a successor framework. Projects submitted after this announcement should be evaluated against the batch study timeline and process rules rather than the pre-batch LLIS process alone.

review_notes: Citation corrected 2026-02-26: Q&A Rev.12.15.25 does not discuss batch study (published 8 days before M-A122325-01). Re-anchored to M-A122325-01 which is the authoritative source for batch study process announcement. Confidence raised to 0.95.

loc: Rev.12.15.25, p.2 ("The interim process has applied to both stand-alone large load customers and those co-locating with existing or planned generation.")

criteria.text: The revised Large Load Q&A (Rev. 12.15.25) continues to explicitly include co-located loads (with existing or planned generation) within the LLIS applicability scope. Co-located configurations carry elevated coordination and study dependency.

review_notes: Rev.12.15.25 citation for co-location applicability (replaces/supplements LL_QA_017 which cites Jun 2025 version). Promote once PDF sha256 is confirmed.

loc: ERCOT-Large-Load-Batch-Studies-LLWG_01222026.pptx (material change handling in batch process)

criteria.text: Under the proposed batch study process, a material change to an in-queue project (e.g., POI change, load increase, timeline acceleration) may cause the project to be re-slotted into a subsequent batch cycle rather than being re-studied individually. This can compound timeline delays beyond what the current individualized re-study framework implies.

review_notes: Interaction between material change and batch study cycle. Confidence 0.75 pending final batch rules. Complements existing LL_QA_006 / PG9_026–027 which describe the re-study obligation without the batch scheduling dimension.

loc: M-A122325-01, LONG DESCRIPTION: structural challenges including "coordination across TSPs, repeated restudies, and a growing backlog." Also corroborated by Q&A Rev.12.15.25 p.10: "A common reason re-studies are needed is that another large load customer in the same area becomes a must-study load."

criteria.text: Under the batch study framework, the entry of a large number of must-study projects in the same geographic cohort can delay all cohort members simultaneously – analogous to the existing re-study risk in the individualized process (LL_QA_010) but potentially affecting larger groups of projects at once.

review_notes: Extends LL_QA_010_RESTUDY_QUEUE to the batch-study context. Useful for explaining to clients why queue density affects timing even in the new framework. Pair with BATCH_001-005.

loc: M-A122325-03, full notice (Jan 30, 2026): draft framework posted for Feb 3 workshop; feedback deadline Feb 5; sets up Feb 12 second workshop; framework to be filed at Feb 20 PUC Open Meeting.

criteria.text: ERCOT market notice series M-A122325 (notices -01 through -05) collectively announce the policy direction toward a Batch Study Process. Individually, each notice may update process details, timelines, or requirements. Projects should track the full series to avoid acting on superseded notice provisions.

review_notes: Informational: ensures the memo references the full notice series rather than a single notice. Non-risk tags (policy_update, market_notice) so it appears in evidence but doesn't inflate risk score.

loc: M-A122325-05, full notice (Feb 17, 2026): "PUC recently provided guidance to ERCOT and stakeholders to engage in an expedited process to develop revision requests that create a new Batch Zero study for consideration at the June 1, 2026 ERCOT Board meeting."

criteria.text: ERCOT Market Notice M-A122325-05 is the latest in the M-A122325 series as of 2026-02-26. It may contain the most current batch study process details, timelines, or eligibility criteria announced prior to the final rule. Projects assessing study timeline risk should reference this notice for the most recent ERCOT policy position.

review_notes: Check ercot.com to confirm -05 is still the latest notice; update doc_id and loc if a newer notice has been issued. This rule exists to make the 'latest notice' explicit in the memo audit trail.

loc: M-A122325-01 (context: public reporting of ERCOT shift to data-center batch study framework)

criteria.text: ERCOT is transitioning from individualized Large Load studies to a batch study process, partly in response to a surge in data center and large-load interconnection requests. This macro shift means projects submitted in the near term may face a different study process than projects submitted under the current framework, creating planning uncertainty for any project with a 2026-2028 energization target.

review_notes: High-level context rule for memo narrative (governance transition). Anchors to authoritative ERCOT notice rather than press reporting. Pairs well with BATCH_001-005.

loc: M-A022326-01, LONG DESCRIPTION: "ERCOT will not approve LLIS studies for Large Load additions in the Far West unless they include a no-solar scenario." Counties: Andrews, Borden, Brewster, Coke, Concho, Crane, Crockett, Culberson, Dawson, Ector, Edwards, Fisher, Glasscock, Howard, Irion, Jeff Davis, Jones, Kinney, Loving, Lynn, Martin, Midland, Mitchell, Nolan, Pecos, Presidio, Reagan, Reeves, Schleicher, Scurry, Sterling, Sutton, Terrell, Tom Green, Upton, Val Verde, Ward, Winkler.

criteria.text: Due to the 'no-solar scenario' assumption applied in ERCOT LLIS studies for the Far West area, projects in this region may face higher identified upgrade costs and longer resolution timelines compared to projects in other ERCOT zones – even for similar load sizes and configurations.

review_notes: Companion to FAR_WEST_001-002. Explicitly links Far West scenario to upgrade_exposure bucket (upgrade score +3 from new_line tag). Strong risk signal for memo if project is in Far West area. Scope to a region field once added to request schema.

loc: M-A022326-01, ACTION REQUIRED: "TSPs for Large Loads requesting to interconnect within the identified counties that have LLIS studies that are not started or are currently in progress, as well as studies approved under §9.4 but where ILLE has not met §9.5 requirements as of 2026-02-23, must update the study to include a no-solar scenario."

criteria.text: ERCOT study results for Far West Texas projects may be conditional on specific system scenarios (e.g., no-solar) that could change with the addition or retirement of regional generation resources. If system assumptions change materially before energization, a restudy may be required even if no project-level changes occur.

review_notes: Captures the 'study results can be invalidated by system-level changes' dimension specific to Far West. Fires when LLIS is already complete (post-study phase). Pair with FAR_WEST_001-003 and RESTUDY_001.

loc: PUCT Project No. 58481, docket (Sierra Club comments reference 50% backup generation threshold, SB 6 compliance, and large load qualification standards under 16 TAC §25.194)

criteria.text: Pending PUCT rulemaking under Project 58481 may modify energization prerequisites, TSP/ILLE obligations, or ERCOT approval authority for Large Load projects. Projects targeting energization in 2026-2028 should confirm that their energization checklist reflects any adopted rule changes before finalizing the readiness assessment.

review_notes: Energization-stage companion to PUCT_001-002. Lower confidence (0.7) because impact on specific energization requirements is speculative. Update once PUCT rule text is adopted and specific changed clauses are known.
